bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Reference Librarian, Main Public Library, Grand Rapids, Michigan, September 5, 1940

div1.p: Hench inquires about a newspaper article on Dean, and asks for a photo of the Dean Memorial Bridge.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Reference Librarian, Main Public Library, Grand Rapids, Michigan, September 5, 1940
div1.opener:
September 5, 1940
Reference Librarian
Main Public Library
Grand Rapids, Michigan
Dear Madam:
div1.p:
On or about May 5, 1928, William H. Dean died
in Grand Rapids. He was a private in the U. S. Army during the
Spanish-American War and while there, volunteered to Major Walter
Reed to be bitten by an infected mosquito, thereby contracting
experimental yellow fever. I am preparing an address on the con-
quest of yellow fever, and I am anxious to know whether there was
much of an article in any Grand Rapids papers at the time of his
death, perhaps giving details of his life, and a picture. I will
appreciate it greatly if you would look over your files in the
Grand Rapids papers of that date, and let me know if you find
anything. If so, could I have it photostated?

Also, can you tell me whether there is a Dean
Bridge in Grand Rapids? I understand that there is a Dean
Memorial Bridge. Would it be possible for me to get a photograph
of it? If there are picture postcards, they would be quite all
right. Otherwise, I should like a snapshot, or, if it doesn't
cost too much, a professional photograph.
Please accept my sincere thanks for this courtesy.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
